intro: Gratiola uruguayensis, commonly known as the Uruguay yellowroot, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Uruguay and parts of Argentina. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and studied for its chemical properties.
